page.title: 14HOSPITALS IN CATERHAM PAGE 3
page.content:
{THE DENE HOSPITAL}is built on the corner of Waller Lane and Church Road. Before it became a hospital it was a school. In the 1970's they proposed to close the hospital. Soon an action group called{FRIENDS OF THE DENE} decided to raise money to keep the Dene open. The money was raised by concerts, marathon runs, donations etc.
Now the old building is a geriatric hospital. The new building is a psychiatric unit and a physiotherapy department, both open daily.
They used to hold an annual firework display in a field next to the Dene. They can't any more as they have built the new buildings on the field.
